subject: Personal Finance
title: The Latin American Debt Crisis
description: Learn The Latin American Debt Crisis in one minute.

hook.text: In the 1980s, Latin American countries owed more than they could ever repay. They nearly defaulted.

buildup.text: In the 1970s, oil-rich nations deposited petrodollars in Western banks, which lent them to Latin America.

discovery.text: When US interest rates spiked in 1981, these dollar-denominated debts became impossible to service.

twist.text: Mexico announced it couldn't pay in August 1982. A domino effect threatened the entire banking system.

climax.text: The crisis led to a 'lost decade' of economic stagnation across Latin America.

punchline.text: Borrowing in someone else's currency is risky.

quiz.question: What triggered the Latin American debt crisis?
options: US interest rate hikes made dollar debts unaffordable
